lyrics:
7 contributorswhere rainbows never die lyricsverse 1
im an old man now i cant do nothing
young folks dont pay me no mind
but in my day i sure was something
before i felt the heavy hand of time

verse 2
im an old man now im bound for glory
time to lay these burdens down
had enough of this old world of worry
gonna trade my troubles for a crown

chorus
i will make my way across the fields of cotton
and wade through muddy waters one last time
and in my dreams i come out clean
when i reach the other side
west of where the sun sets where rainbows never die

verse 3
ive got one last thing to do
one more mile before im through
casting off these earthly chains
going where theres no more pain

chorus
i will make my way across the fields of cotton
and wade through muddy waters one last time
and in my dreams i come out clean
when i reach the other side
west of where the sun sets where rainbows never die
see the steeldrivers liveget tickets as low as 43you might also likeoutro
im an old man now cant do nothing
young folks dont pay me no mindembed
